subject: Law
title: Mental Health and the Law
description: A 60-second lesson on Mental Health and the Law.

hook.text: An employee with depression is fired for missing work. Under the ADA, the employer may have broken the law.

buildup.text: Depression, PTSD, and anxiety qualify as disabilities under the ADA when they limit major life activities.

discovery.text: Employers must provide reasonable accommodations: flexible hours, remote work, or modified duties.

twist.text: Stigma remains the biggest barrier. Many employees don't request help because they fear being seen as weak.

climax.text: The pandemic normalized mental health conversations at work and increased accommodation requests significantly.

punchline.text: Mental health is a legal right at work. Using that right still takes courage.

quiz.question: Are mental health conditions covered by the ADA?
options: Yes, if they substantially limit major life activities
Only if diagnosed by a court
